intro: Styphelia multiflora, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing shrub that typically thrives in acidic, well-drained soils found in forested areas. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pink in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Styphelia multiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain slopes and pine forests.
